Description: Upper body sherd of Attic red-figured pottery bell- or calyx-krater; interior glazed with reserved band near top of wall; exterior: red-figure decoration consisting of Zeus and Hermes (of Zeus, head with wreath in added white and top of sceptre remain, seated to right; of Hermes, upper body with part of white wreath remain, standing to right, holding caduceus); relief contour for details.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Fitzwilliam Museum, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Also illustrated in Bourriau, J.D., Umm El-Ga`ab (1981) p. 84 no. 164.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1162)
